channel.title: Launchpad Manager Changelog
channel.description: Most recent changes with links to updates.

item.title: Version 1.3.11
item.description:
Last release of Launchpad Manager

Included compatibility info for OS X Yosemite

item.title: Version 1.3.10
item.description:
Bug Fixes

  • Fixed some problems with item ordering logic that was causing issues with grouping and moving items to new page

item.title: Version 1.3.9
item.description:
Bug fix

  • Fixed removed apps not showing up in Available tab

item.title: Version 1.3.8
item.description:
Mavericks 10.9.1 update fixes

Some changes were introduced to Launchpad in OS X 10.9.1 update that were breaking Launchpad Manager. These issues should be fixed now, please let me know if you are still having issues.

item.title: Version 1.3.7
item.description:
Additional layout loading/saving fixes for Mavericks

As many users reported there are still issues with loading and saving layouts I have rewritten the logic to be as safe as possible. Unfortunately Mavericks itself seems to have issues with Launchpad so there is no guarantee it will always behave as expected. Save your layouts frequently into separate files.

item.title: Version 1.3.6
item.description: Load layout bugfix: loading layout didn't work in certain cases, should be fixed now.

item.title: Version 1.3.5
item.description:
Even more Mavericks fixes

  • Saving the layout before applying was causing serious issue, which is now fixed.

item.title: Version 1.3.4
item.description:
More Mavericks fixes

Many users reported weird behavior under Mavericks. If you see anything out of place please don't use your saved layout but start afresh by clicking 'Regenerate'. If after that you are still experiencing issues please report them to me along with the steps to reproduce if it (if possible). Apologies for the inconvenience, I'm trying to get all these issues fixed ASAP.

item.title: Version 1.3.3
item.description:
Mavericks fixed

  • Grouped items appear at the correct place
  • Items appear correctly after alphabetical ordering
  • Saving / Loading layout works

Please note that migrating layout files between different OS X versions is not supported so you won't be able to load the layouts in Mavericks that you saved in Mountain Lion.

item.title: Version 1.3.2
item.description:
Bug fixes

  • Saving layout saves the actual state (it was saving the last applied one)
  • Fixed incorrect no space for ungroupping message
  • Fixed losing changes when switching between tabs (option to save is offered)
  • Got rid of external Launchpad db change popup

item.title: Version 1.3.1
item.description:
New Feature

  • Cut and paste operation that makes moving items around pages and groups much quicker and easier

item.title: Version 1.2.13
item.description:
Bug fix

  • Additional fixes for crashing

item.title: Version 1.2.12
item.description:
Bug fix

  • Fixed initial crash at DB detection

item.title: Version 1.2.11
item.description:
Bug fix

  • Fixed bug with switching between Apps/Widgets/Available tabs

item.title: Version 1.2.10
item.description:
Bug fix

  • Reverted back the fast icon loading as it was causing lots of problems for many users

item.title: Version 1.2.9
item.description:
Bug fix

  • Reverted back the fast icon loading as it was causing lots of problems for many users

item.title: Version 1.2.8
item.description:
Important bug fix

  • The previous version was crashing for some people, this version should sort out the crashing problem

item.title: Version 1.2.7
item.description:
Minor improvements

  • Faster icon loading
  • Handling database correctly Launchpad Control have been used on

item.title: Version 1.2.6
item.description:
New feature:

  • Add missing applications to Launchpad from your Applications folder

    Bug fixes

  • Ungrouping items bug
  • Alphabetical sorting problem
  • Registration anomalies

item.title: Version 1.2.5
item.description:
Bug Fixes


  • For some people the application was not using the correct database file. This has been improved so it should work properly now.

item.title: Version 1.2.4
item.description:
Improved Mountain Lion support


  • Widgets can be managed as well. Only the Renaming functionality works in the Demo version.
  • Mountain Lion crash fixes

item.title: Version 1.2.3
item.description:
Improved Mountain Lion support


  • Widgets can be managed as well. Only the Renaming functionality works in the Demo version.
  • Hotfix: icons were not showing in Lion. It's fixed now they should be shown. If you're still experiencing probelms in Lion please let know!

item.title: Version 1.2.2
item.description:
Improved Mountain Lion support


  • Widgets can be managed as well. Only the Renaming functionality works in the Demo version.

item.title: Version 1.2.1
item.description:
First Mountain Lion version

This is a very important update if you are planning to use Launchpad Manager on Mountain Lion. The previous version will not display the layout correctly and can lead to unexpected behaviours.

Note: the application is of course still fully compatible with all versions of OS X Lion 10.7.x.

Please update to this version for Mountain Lion!

item.title: Version 1.1.2
item.description:
Important New Feature

  • Save/Load Launchpad Layout
    This feature lets you save the layout of the launchpad once you're happy with it. Some users were having problem with Launchpad randomly restoring the layout, this feature can be a good solution for that.

    Experimental: it may be possible to use the layout on a different computer to which it was saved on but there's no guarantee for it to work properly. Use it at your own risk (however things can't go that wrong, the worst case is that you have to regenerate the Launchpad database).
  • Hotfix: Toolbar layout has been fixed, the apply button is now visible

item.title: Version 1.1.1
item.description:
Important New Feature

  • Save/Load Launchpad Layout
    This feature lets you save the layout of the launchpad once you're happy with it. Some users were having problem with Launchpad randomly restoring the layout, this feature can be a good solution for that.

    Experimental: it may be possible to use the layout on a different computer to which it was saved on but there's no guarantee for it to work properly. Use it at your own risk (however things can't go that wrong, the worst case is that you have to regenerate the Launchpad database).

item.title: Version 1.0.9
item.description:
Bug Fixes

  • Sorting group alphabetically doesn't sort items outside the group

item.title: Version 1.0.8
item.description:
New features

  • Sort group alphabetically

Bug fixes

  • More than 6 pages problem fixed

item.title: Version 1.0.7
item.description:
New features

  • Clear indication of registartion
  • Move items to another page
  • Move items to new page (PRO version only)

item.title: Version 1.0.6
item.description: Minor cosmetic fixes

item.title: Version 1.0.5
item.description:
New features:

  • Alphabetical ordering only on selected pages

item.title: Version 1.0.4
item.description:
Minor fixes

  • Minor bug fixes
  • Easier purchase

item.title: Version 1.0.3
item.description: First public version
